sentence.Network_en: Gregory was still enchanted with Shannon's youth and joy and beauty.
sentence.Network_cn: 格雷戈里仍为香农的朝气、快乐和美丽着迷。

sentence.Network_en: Gregory'sfather had implanted in him an ambition to obtain an education.
sentence.Network_cn: 格雷戈里的父亲早就向他灌输了要接受教育的志向。

sentence.Network_en: The university refused to let Dick Gregory speak on campus.
sentence.Network_cn: 这所大学不让迪克·格雷戈里在校园里发表演说。

list.abs: 到那时，教皇格雷哥里十三世（Pope Gregory）才下令加以纠正。在苏格兰，1600年就加以纠正，但是，在英格兰，到1752年才加以 …
六世纪末，教皇格列高列（pope gregory）对“七宗罪”进行了描述，按照严重程度由轻到重排列，依次是傲慢、妒忌、**怒、懒惰、贪 …
经过葛瑞利贝特生(Gregory Bateson)的转介绍， 班德勒和葛瑞德俩人认识并研究催眠大师米尔顿艾瑞克森(Milton Erickson) 的催眠疗 …
这些问题好像根本就没有合理的答案。这些让人困惑的问题正是格雷戈里贝特森（Gregory Bateson）的逼疯海豚实验的研究主题。

means.word_mean: 1. the pope who sponsored the introduction of the modern calendar (1572-1585)
2. the pope who fought to establish the supremacy of the pope over the Church and the supremacy of the Church over the state (1020-1085)
3. (Roman Catholic Church) a pope distinguished for his spiritual and temporal leadership; a saint and Doctor of the Church (540?-604)
